docs.text: some movies have such an impact that they linger in your mind long after the credits have rolled , making you think carefully and recollect on what you have just seen .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i finished mike figgis' " leaving las vegas " hours ago , and it is still as haunting as when i hit rewind on the vcr .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: alot of people refer to this film as " that flick where nick cage plays that alcoholic dude " .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " leaving las vegas " is not so much a movie about alcoholism as it is a story about two people who except each other for what they are : a drunk and a whore .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ben ( nicolas cage in possibly the best male performance of the past twenty years ) is the drunk .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his family and friends have long since abandon him , and all he has left is his liquor .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in a scene early in the film , we see ben staggering into a resteraunt , looking for a " friend " of his to mooch some money off of .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he finds the guy ( richard lewis ) having dinner with a buddy and two chicks , trying to crack witty jokes that just come out stupid .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when ben approaches the table , you can clearly sense that everyone immediatly feels uncomfortable .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after lewis gives ben the money , he coldly says " i think it would be best if you didn't contact me again . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: now even though through the course of the film , some much more depressing things happen , this is when i felt the most for ben .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there was such a look of sorrow and dispare on his face , ( not to sound hokey or anything ) it almost brought a tear to my eye .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it turns out that ben was once a semi-successful hollywood player , and apparently a pretty popular guy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: now he spends his time getting robbed by hookers and trying desperatly to pick up women , not so much for the sex , but for the company ; for someone to talk to or spend time with .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: once he is fired from his job , ben decides to burn all his belongings , collect all his cash and relocate to las vegas to slowly drink himself to death .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one night he runs into a prostitute ( a brilliant performance by elizabeth shue - how far she has come since " adventures in babysitting " ) named sera .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: she is involved in an abusive relationship with her pimp , a scumbag who gets-off by cutting her .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they are both very lonely , self-destructive people .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they immediatly hit it off , both of them realizing that they need one another .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and it isn't even a sexual relationship .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they don't even have sex until , like , the last ten minutes of the film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " leaving las vegas " is not a film about plot .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: with the exception of what i have already revealed ( which all happens in the first thirty minutes or so , by the way ) , there isn't too much of a story to it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is more a film about people and how they react to one another .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: from what i can see , this is basically a perfect film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the direction is great ( with mike figgis doing a brilliant mix between the glamor of las vegas and the moody , smokey atmosphere of a film noir ) and it contains two of the best performances to come out of the 90s , or any other decade for that matter .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but don't go rushing out to see this movie without knowing what you're getting yourself into .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: first off , if you are easily offended by frank sexual dialouge , stay away from " leaving las vegas " .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is filled with lengthy discussions of orgasms , rape and various forms of perverted activities involving burbon ( that's right ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: secondly , if you are not in the mood to see a very depressing film , don't see it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , if you are cool with those two things , you are in for one of the most memorable experiences you will ever have .
docs.label: positive
